result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice King Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice King Jr in court.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court for Maurice King Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense was recently appointed and need time to meet with client. Defense requested a Pretrial Conference date. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Maurice King Jr
Current: 3745 N 20th Street Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 3610 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Maurice King Jr in court. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 13.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Maurice King not in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for a pre-trial conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner, and bail forfeited.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ES and RV.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Maurice King in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Maurice King not in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/22 @ 2:30p
